results.title: Moving house
results.creator_credit: British Transport Films and Public Relations Films
results.brief_description: A family move from one house to another is one of those human experiences which are commonly regarded with foreboding. But if the operation is carried out by experienced and reliable moving-men there is no need for it to be a nightmare. The late Richard Massingham was invited to apply his highly personal technique to a problem for which the more solemn forms of documentary presentation would have been entirely inappropriate.

results.title: Moving big trees
results.creator_credit: World Wide Pictures and Pathe Pictures
results.brief_description: The Civic Trust (London) works to redress the loss of trees (generally due to urbanization and other development) by cheap and simple means. Describes the process from selection and preparation of trees to relocation.

results.title: Moving and lifting the disabled person
results.creator_credit: Gateway Film Productions and Robin Ridgeway
results.brief_description: One of the most serious problems facing a family having a disabled member is that of moving and lifting them satisfactorily. The disabled person can be moved without hurting the helper and with dignity and comfort to them. Presented by the Multiple Sclerosis Society of Great Britain and Northern Ireland.

results.title: Movietone news
results.brief_description: Movietone cinemagazine items include: A new series of fire extinguishers and fire prevention demonstrated; presentation of gallantry awards by the Duchess of Kent at the Royal National Lifeboat Institute; description of a new rescue boat; displays of English fashion for export; a report on cemetary damage by vandals at Basingstoke; footage of new “crazes” - surfsailing and surf-racing.

results.title: Movietone memories
results.creator_credit: Chris Oliver, Film World, Tru-Vu Pictures and Alec Morgan
results.brief_description: A unique time capsule of our country’s past as captured by the Movietone news crews from the early thirties though to the mid fifties. The headlines, our sporting achivements, the tragedies, and our nation’s often off-beat sense of humour.

results.title: Movies move people
results.brief_description: The world depends on information - films can do a great deal. They can support an idea or change one; they can give an insight into some experience; they can give an inside view of written things; they can be a diagram in motion; film is able to affect attitudes because it affects emotions - it’s a vehicle for the imagination; a method to make thought understood.
